array.string: Hello!
Today we are going to look at some sorting algorithms.
Sorting algorithms are used all the time in computers and are really important.
Let's look at some examples.
Imagine you want to list all your songs by song name.
The songs need to be sorted!
There are many ways we can go about sorting such a list.
The set of rules we follow to complete a task like sorting is called an ALGORITHM.
Some really smart people have already done the hard work and figured out some sorting algorithms for us.
Although, some sorting algorithms work much faster than other ones...
...but there's no perfect sorting algorithm. Some work better than others for different tasks.
But how do we know if the sorting algorithm that we are using is any good?
It's important to know this so that we don't choose an algorithm that slows our whole program down!
We use something called 'Big-O' notation to measure algorithm's performance.
It's a little maths-y, but a really good way to measure how good an algorithm is.
I don't really have time to explain it now, so I'll just tell you which algorithms are best for what sort of task.
It's not too complicated, so look it up if you're interested!
Anyway, enough of me talking, let's introduce some of my emoji friends!
We are going to be sorting these emojis today.
Each emoji has some traits and you're going to be able to sort them by these traits!
I've given you a few algorithms you can use to sort them.
Enough talking. Let's get sorting!
